entry.title: Data Visualization Hackday

entry.title: How To Open Source
entry.content:
A hands-on workshp with Rackspace developers on Berkeley's campus.

Hosted by Hack Berkeley

5. April, 2012

How to Open Source: In this workshop we will contribute in real time to a widely-used Open Source project while explaining best practices. Attendees will then hack on patches themselves with help from in-person and remote open source contributors.

Why Open Source?

  • To improve software that makes a difference to other people
  • To become better software developers and collaborators
  • To document one's abilities for potential employers

See you there!

TBA location (somewhere on Berkeley’s campus)

Open Source Projects

  • Dreadnot
  • Github developer stats and Twisted Highscores)
  • devops.json
  • gutsy
  • libcloud
  • OpenStack
  • LUVIT

entry.title: Intern Hackday
entry.content:
Hack with Rackspace employees and get a sweet summer internship in San Francisco

3. March, 2012

  • 10.00am: Start Hacking
  • 5.30pm: Rackspace Tech Talk and Q&A
  • 6.00pm: Demos

After lunch we’ll have a campus tour, plus ad-hoc tech talks and whiteboarding as necessary.

Food, drinks and skeeball provided.

See you there!

  • Rackspace San Francisco
  • 620 Folsom Street
  • Suite 100 (Ground Floor)

Some ideas

  • Dreadnot snaps a photo when a user clicks deploy
  • Async service that tracks developer metrics (eg, Github developer stats or Twisted Highscores)
  • IRC/chat bot to read and post tweets (or interact with some API)
  • Hooking via Hook.io
  • Webhook handler
  • Something with or like Gerrit
  • Patch an open source library with a small feature or bug fix
  • Write or use a javsacript OpenStack API
  • Keystone signed tokens, or implement a new protocol for Keystone
  • REST interfaces for language-specific libraries a la libcloud.rest
  • REST interface for cron jobs a la cron.io
  • Web interface for remote terminal a la tty.js
  • Build something with Lua and libuv LUVIT

More tools

  • openstack
  • twisted python
  • libcloud
  • nodejs
  • async
  • express
  • jade
  • bootstrap
  • django

Register

  • Eventbrite

entry.title: Node Js Hackday
entry.content:
Hack on projects using node.js at Rackspace's new San Francisco office.

We’re hanging out in #nodejshackday on irc.freenode.net

29. February, 2012

Hack all day, or come watch the demos and hang out afterwards. Brought to you by developers at Rackspace and Nodejitsu.

9.00 amStart Hacking
11.00 amTech Talk on "Using Node.js as an API server" by Paul Querna from Rackspace
11.15 amTech Talk on "Modules you should be using" by Mikeal Rogers from Pouch
6.00 pmTech Talk on "Building a federated architecture" by James Halliday from StackVM
6.30 pmTech Talk on "Profiling Node.js in production" by David Pacheco from Joyent / Joyent Cloud
7.00 pmDemos (prizes sponsored by GitHub and Rackspace)
8.00 pmMove to a local bar

Food, beer and skeeball provided. Bring ideas or find a team.

See you there!

  • Rackspace San Francisco
  • 620 Folsom Street (near 2nd in SoMa)
  • Suite 100 (Ground Floor)

Some ideas

  • Developer stats site; turn this into a game a la Twisted Highscores
  • IRC Bots that integrate with build, deployment, tracking tools
  • REST interfaces for language-specific libraries a la libcloud.rest
  • REST interface for cron jobs a la cron.io
  • Web interface for remote terminal a la tty.js

Useful tools

  • nodejs
  • async
  • express
  • jade
  • bootstrap
  • backbone.ioBind

Register

  • Eventbrite

entry.title: Twisted Python Hackday
entry.content:
Successful first public Rackspace SF Hackday!
Around 35 hackers showed up and created some sweet demos.

Come hack on Twisted and Twisted projects at Rackspace’s new San Francisco office. Bring ideas or find a team. This Hackday will feature Jean-Paul Calderone @jpcalderone from Twisted Matrix Labs

Doors open at 9:00am, demos at 9pm. Hack all day, or come hang out (7pm) and watch demos (9pm). Food, beer and skeeball provided. See you there!

Rackspace San Francisco 620 Folsom Street Suite 100 (Ground Floor)

Some ideas:

  • IRC bots
  • REST interface for a python library (to make it accessible to other languages)
  • libuv reactor
  • find blocking code better, eg monkey patch sql calls in twisted
  • fix the bug so that the glade reactor gui is back “twistd –reactor debug-gui -n web”

Cross posts:

  • Eventbrite
  • Meetup | Bay Area Software Engineers
